categories.name: Delivery & Streaming
categories.description: Next-generation codec with superior compression efficiency

codecs.name: H.265 (HEVC)
codecs.description: Next-generation codec with superior compression efficiency
codecs.workflowNotes: Better compression than H.264, ideal for 4K/8K streaming. Requires more processing power but delivers smaller file sizes.

codecs.name: AV1
codecs.description: Latest open-source codec with superior compression
codecs.workflowNotes: Future-proof codec with excellent compression efficiency. Slower encoding but significantly smaller file sizes.

variants.name: High Profile
variants.description: Advanced AV1 profile with enhanced features

variants.name: Professional Profile
variants.description: Professional AV1 profile for high-end applications

codecs.name: VP9
codecs.description: Google's open-source codec for web streaming
codecs.workflowNotes: Used by YouTube and other Google services. Good compression efficiency with royalty-free licensing.

codecs.name: H.264 (AVC)
codecs.description: Most widely supported codec for delivery
codecs.workflowNotes: Best for web streaming, social media, and general distribution. Excellent compatibility across all devices and platforms.

variants.name: Main Profile
variants.description: Standard profile for broadcast and streaming

categories.name: Broadcast
categories.description: Wavelet-based codec for high-end broadcast applications

codecs.name: JPEG 2000
codecs.description: Wavelet-based codec for high-end broadcast applications
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in high-end broadcast workflows and digital cinema distribution. Excellent image quality with scalable compression.

codecs.name: MPEG-2
codecs.description: Traditional broadcast standard still used in many applications
codecs.workflowNotes: Legacy format widely used in broadcast television, DVD, and satellite transmission. Still relevant for certain broadcast workflows.

codecs.name: MXF D-10 (IMX)
codecs.description: MXF D-10 format for professional broadcast and cinema workflows
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in professional broadcast and cinema workflows. Excellent for high-quality video and audio recording.

categories.name: Camera Acquisition
categories.description: SD MPEG IMX and DVCAM, Professional Disc

codecs.name: XDCAM SD
codecs.description: SD MPEG IMX and DVCAM, Professional Disc
codecs.workflowNotes: Standard definition, IMX and DVCAM, 4:2:2 and 4:1:1. Also known as XDCAM SD.

codecs.name: Panasonic AVC-Intra
codecs.description: Panasonic's intraframe codec for professional cameras
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in Panasonic professional cameras. Intraframe compression for easy editing and color grading.

codecs.name: XDCAM HD (XDCAM35)
codecs.description: 35 Mb/s MPEG-2 4:2:0, Professional Disc
codecs.workflowNotes: Used for general HD acquisition, 4:2:0 chroma. Also known as XDCAM35 or XDCAM HD. Supports SD fallback.

variants.name: HD HQ 35 Mb/s
variants.description: 35 Mb/s, 4:2:0, MXF, Professional Disc. Supports SD fallback.

variants.name: HD SP 25 Mb/s
variants.description: 25 Mb/s, 4:2:0, MXF, Professional Disc. Supports SD fallback.

variants.name: HD LP 18 Mb/s
variants.description: 18 Mb/s, 4:2:0, MXF, Professional Disc. Supports SD fallback.

codecs.name: XDCAM EX
codecs.description: SxS card-based, 35/25/18 Mb/s, 4:2:0
codecs.workflowNotes: Used for field acquisition, SxS cards, 4:2:0 chroma. Also known as XDCAM EX. Supports SD fallback.

variants.name: EX HQ 35 Mb/s
variants.description: 35 Mb/s, 4:2:0, MP4, SxS. Supports SD fallback.

variants.name: EX SP 25 Mb/s
variants.description: 25 Mb/s, 4:2:0, MP4, SxS. Supports SD fallback.

variants.name: EX LP 18 Mb/s
variants.description: 18 Mb/s, 4:2:0, MP4, SxS. Supports SD fallback.

codecs.name: XDCAM HD422 (XDCAM50)
codecs.description: 50 Mb/s MPEG-2 4:2:2P@HL, broadcast standard
codecs.workflowNotes: Used for broadcast delivery, supports 4:2:2 chroma, 8 audio channels. Also known as XDCAM50 or XDCAM HD422.

variants.name: HD422 50 Mb/s
variants.description: 50 Mb/s, 4:2:2, MXF, Professional Disc/SxS. Supports SD fallback.

codecs.name: Sony XAVC
codecs.description: Sony's modern acquisition format for high-end cameras
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in Sony's professional and cinema cameras. Excellent image quality with efficient compression.

variants.name: XAVC-L
variants.description: Long GOP XAVC for efficient recording

categories.name: Professional Intermediate
categories.description: Industry standard for professional editing and color grading

codecs.name: Apple ProRes
codecs.description: Industry standard for professional editing and color grading
codecs.workflowNotes: Optimized for editing performance with excellent image quality. Widely supported across professional NLEs and color grading systems.

variants.name: ProRes 422 Proxy
variants.description: Lowest quality for offline editing and proxies

variants.name: ProRes 422 LT
variants.description: Lower quality for basic editing workflows

variants.name: ProRes 4444
variants.description: Highest quality with alpha channel support

variants.name: ProRes 4444 XQ
variants.description: Extreme quality for high-end color grading

codecs.name: GoPro CineForm
codecs.description: Wavelet-based intermediate codec for mixed resolution workflows
codecs.workflowNotes: Excellent for mixed resolution projects and cross-platform compatibility. Good balance of quality and file size.

variants.name: CineForm Film Scan
variants.description: Highest quality for film scanning applications

codecs.name: Avid DNxHD/HR
codecs.description: Avid's professional codec family optimized for editorial workflows
codecs.workflowNotes: Designed for Avid Media Composer and broadcast workflows. Excellent for collaborative editing environments.

variants.name: DNxHD 36
variants.description: Lowest quality DNxHD for offline editing

variants.name: DNxHD 145
variants.description: Standard quality DNxHD for online editing

variants.name: DNxHD 175
variants.description: High quality DNxHD for 23.98/24/25/29.97/30 workflows (10-bit variant is 175x)

variants.name: DNxHR LB
variants.description: Low Bandwidth DNxHR for proxy workflows

categories.name: RAW & Cinema
categories.description: Apple's RAW format combining RAW flexibility with ProRes efficiency

codecs.name: ProRes RAW
codecs.description: Apple's RAW format combining RAW flexibility with ProRes efficiency
codecs.workflowNotes: Maintains maximum image quality and color grading flexibility while providing efficient workflows in Final Cut Pro and other NLEs.

codecs.name: Canon Cinema RAW
codecs.description: Canon's cinema RAW format for professional cameras
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in Canon's cinema cameras like the C300, C500, and C700 series. Optimized for Canon's color science and workflows.

variants.name: Cinema RAW Light
variants.description: Compressed RAW format for efficient workflows

variants.name: Cinema RAW ST
variants.description: Standard RAW format for maximum quality

codecs.name: Blackmagic RAW
codecs.description: Blackmagic Design's intelligent RAW format
codecs.workflowNotes: Intelligent RAW codec with excellent compression efficiency. Optimized for DaVinci Resolve workflows with real-time playback.

codecs.name: RED R3D
codecs.description: RED Digital Cinema's proprietary RAW format
codecs.workflowNotes: Professional cinema RAW with variable compression ratios. Industry standard for high-end film and commercial production.

codecs.name: Arri RAW
codecs.description: Arri's uncompressed RAW format for maximum quality and flexibility
codecs.workflowNotes: Industry standard RAW format used in high-end cinema production. Provides maximum color grading flexibility and image quality. Used in Alexa LF, Mini LF, and other Arri cameras.

variants.name: ARRIRAW 2.8K
variants.description: 2.8K resolution ARRIRAW for Alexa Classic and Amira

variants.name: ARRIRAW 3.2K
variants.description: 3.2K resolution ARRIRAW for Alexa XT and Amira

variants.name: ARRIRAW 4.5K
variants.description: 4.5K resolution ARRIRAW for Alexa SXT and Amira

variants.name: ARRIRAW 6.5K
variants.description: 6.5K resolution ARRIRAW for Alexa LF and Mini LF

variants.name: ARRICORE 2.8K
variants.description: ARRICORE compressed RAW for Alexa Classic and Amira

variants.name: ARRICORE 3.2K
variants.description: ARRICORE compressed RAW for Alexa XT and Amira

variants.name: ARRICORE 4.5K
variants.description: ARRICORE compressed RAW for Alexa SXT and Amira

variants.name: ARRICORE 6.5K
variants.description: ARRICORE compressed RAW for Alexa LF and Mini LF

categories.name: Archival & Preservation
categories.description: Raw uncompressed video for maximum quality preservation

codecs.name: Uncompressed Video
codecs.description: Raw uncompressed video for maximum quality preservation
codecs.workflowNotes: Used for master archival copies where storage space is not a concern. Provides bit-perfect preservation of original content.

codecs.name: FFV1 (in Matroska/MKV)
codecs.description: Lossless intra-frame codec designed for archival and preservation
codecs.workflowNotes: Preferred by archives for its lossless compression, error resilience, and open specification. Typically stored in Matroska (MKV) container.

variants.name: FFV1 Version 3
variants.description: Most common version for archival use with variable bitrates

codecs.name: Lossless JPEG 2000
codecs.description: Mathematically lossless JPEG 2000 for archival applications
codecs.workflowNotes: Provides lossless compression with better efficiency than uncompressed while maintaining mathematical integrity for archival purposes.

categories.name: Unknown Category
categories.description: New standard for the VC-3 Codec in Interoperable Master Format (IMF).

codecs.name: ST 2067-70
codecs.description: New standard for the VC-3 Codec in Interoperable Master Format (IMF).
